org.jtrim.cache

Enum JavaRefObjectCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<JavaRefObjectCache>
      • org.jtrim.cache.JavaRefObjectCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<JavaRefObjectCache>, ObjectCache

    public enum JavaRefObjectCache
extends java.lang.Enum<JavaRefObjectCache>
implements ObjectCache
    An ObjectCache implementation which is directly backed by the JVM. This class can be used to provide volatile references created by GenericReference.createReference(Object, ReferenceType) through the ObjectCache interface.

    This implementation of ObjectCache is intended to be used where an ObjectCache is required but there is non available.

    Note that this class is a singleton and its one and only instance can be accessed by JavaRefObjectCache.INSTANCE.

    Thread safety

    This class is completely thread-safe and its methods can be called from any thread.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are synchronization transparent, so they can be called in any context (e.g.: while holding a lock).

      • getReference

        public <V> VolatileReference<V> getReference(V obj,
                                    ReferenceType refType)
        Creates a volatile reference of the specified object which is directly backed by the JVM. The result of this method is equivalent to:

        GenericReference.createReference(obj, refType)

        Specified by:
        getReference in interface ObjectCache
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the object to be referenced
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to referenced. The returned volatile reference will return this object or null. This argument can be null.
        refType - the required reference type. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the volatile reference of the passed object. This method will never return null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the reference type is null
